cities.name: Rome
cities.description: Rome, the capital city of Italy, is a sprawling, cosmopolitan city with nearly 3,000 years of globally influential art, architecture and culture on display. Ancient ruins such as the Roman Forum and the Colosseum evoke the power of the former Roman Empire.

cities.description: Milan is a global capital of fashion and design. Home to the national stock exchange, itâs a financial hub also known for its high-end restaurants and shops.

cities.name: Siena
cities.description: Siena is a city in Tuscany, Italy. It is known for its medieval brick buildings, narrow streets, and fan-shaped central square, Piazza del Campo, where the Palazzo Pubblico and Torre del Mangia are located.
